Required - the parameter being bound

Optional - the argument supplied for the parameter. Note - if this is null, then technically the parameter binding is invalid.

| Improve this Doc

BindOverload(MethodBase[], IDictionary<String, ITarget>, out MethodBase)

Searches for a method in the methods collection whose parameters can be filled by the targets provided in the args dictionary, returning the parameter bindings, and passing out the resolved target method in resolvedMethod if found.

Note - if no match can be found, or if more than one method could be bound, then an InvalidOperationException will occur.

Declaration
public static ParameterBinding[] BindOverload(MethodBase[] methods, IDictionary<string, ITarget> args, out MethodBase resolvedMethod)

| Improve this Doc

DeriveDefaultParameterBindings(MethodBase)

Automatically derives default parameter bindings for the passed method. This typically means default values for optional parameters and type defaults (0, null etc) for any required parameters.

This is not incredibly useful except in cases where you simply want to bind a method or constructor without requiring any resolved instances/values.

Declaration
public static ParameterBinding[] DeriveDefaultParameterBindings(MethodBase method)
Parameters

MethodBase method
